definition: to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: Second, it is utilized, at times, as a decoy for incorporating the opposition.
sentences.chinese: 其次，政府有時以補助做爲收編反對勢力的誘餌。

sentences.english: That has to involve a cleaning up of the Afghan National Police service, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 收編的過程必須包括徹底清理阿富汗國家警察。

sentences.english: Public and private laws are contained in separate volumes.
sentences.chinese: 公法和私法被分卷收編。

sentences.english: Some volumes arrange thematically the works of different authors.
sentences.chinese: 一些圖書按主題收編不同作者的作品。

definition: Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
